FacilityName: SOUTHERN FS, INC - PINCKNEYVILLE NH3 SITE

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
                                                          PINCKNEYVILLE, IL    NH3 SITE


1.  FACILITY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY.

     THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF SOUTHERN FS, INC  ARE COMMITTED TO THE
     PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTIAL 
     RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPT.,
     OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE
     TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

2.  THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.

     THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY,  WHICH IS LOCATED AT 510 WEST KASKASKIA STREET  
     PINCKNEYVILLE, IL  IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR  SALE TO FARMERS.  ANHYDROUS 
     AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION AS A CROP PRODUCTION 
     NUTRIENT.  THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSISTS OF 1 STORAGE TANK (30,000  GALLONS), LOADING
     RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.  ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED 
     FACILITY EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL AND AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS.

     THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAN BE STORED WOULD BE 
    300,000 POUNDS. THIS INCLUDES ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT COULD BE STORED IN NURSE
     TANKS.



3.   THE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

      THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL 
      APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISION
      OF "SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA,
      K-61.1",  PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AS ADOPTED BY
      STATE REGULATION AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH
      ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS
      A

MMONIA".  COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS AND ON-GOING TRAINING OF OUR EMPLOYEES MAKE UP
      OUR ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

4.   FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.

        THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASES IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAVE OCCURRED AT       
        THIS FACILITY;
        1. WE HAD AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF LESS THAN 1000#S OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA ON APRIL 12, 2006. 
         THERE WERE NO EVACUATIONS BUT ADJACENT HOMES AND BUSSINESS WERE NOTIFIED FOR 
         PRECAUTIONARY MEASURES

5.    THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

       THE FACILITY HAS ...  A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA 
       STANDARD, 29 CFR 1910.38; 
 
        PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY
        RIGHT- TO- KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III  (EPCRA);

        IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, IT IS OUR POLICY TO
        NOTIFY THE PINCKNEYVILLE FIRE DEPT. AND THE PERRY COUNTY LEPC AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND
        TO THE EMERGENCY. OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLANS HAVE BEEN COORDINATED WITH BOTH THE FIRE
        DEPARTMENT AND LEPC.           

6.    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

      SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS
      ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO 
      SPECIFIC SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
